comments:
For example, following the "Creating an Eclipse plug-in" cheat sheet from Eclipse 3.2, when I click the "Launch an Eclipse application" link, I have this error:

java.lang.RuntimeException: Application "org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench"
could not be found in the registry. The applications available are:
<here the names of my applications>
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:68)
	at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.runApplication(EclipseAppLauncher.java:92)
	at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.start(EclipseAppLauncher.java:68)
	at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:400)
	at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:177)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:336)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:280)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:977)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:952)

In the Run dialog for launch configuration, I can only select a product or application from my workspace, but there is no "org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench" in the list.

Also, "Validate plug-in set" in launch configuration says "No problems were detected in the selected set of plug-ins".

we need more information.

what is your target platform location as specified on the Plug-in Development > Target Platform preference page?

what plug-ins does that location contain?  all the sdk plug-ins?

The target platform location is C:\eclipse_target which contains the RCP SDK unzipped and unmodified from eclipse-RCP-SDK-3.2-win32.zip.
It contains 23 plug-ins.
If I change the target platform to Eclipse SDK, the tutorial works. However, as it's recommended to reconfigure the target, I believe it should also work with RCP target.

re comment 3, nm.  you're referring to the 'Creating an Eclipse plug-in' cheatsheet.

>However, as it's recommended to reconfigure the target, I believe it should >also work with RCP target.

I looked at the 'Creating an Eclipse plug-in', and nowhere in it do we tell you to reconfigure the target to an RCP target.

That wouldn't even make sense because the org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench is not contributed by one of the RCP plug-ins.

So please point us to the part where you told to mess with the target.

You're right, it's not recommended in the tutorial itself, but in several places such as Eclipse RCP book, and the RCP faq where you can read:

"With the default setup of the Eclipse SDK, plug-ins are developed against the same plug-in configuration used by the IDE itself. However, it is possible to configure the IDE to build, run and deploy against a different version of the eclipse base, via the Plug-in Development > Target Platform preference page. Configuring the target platform is highly recommended in order to avoid introducing unwanted dependencies on IDE plug-ins into your RCP app."
http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/RCP_FAQ

Reading this, one might expect it's possible to run a plug-in on RCP target.

what's recommended for one scenario (e.g. RCP) is not necessarily what's recommended for regular plug-in development.

Mike, to be on the safe side, can you please add a step to the 'Creating an Eclipse plug-in' cheatsheet to go to the Target Platform preference page to ensure you are pointing to the Eclipse install location and ALL plug-ins are checked.

Fixed.

Work Done:

* Created new task "Configure PDE" in "Create a plug-in" cheatsheet

  -> Merged old task "Open the plug-in development perspective" into it
  
  -> Linked help button to target platform doc in PDE Guide
  
  -> Added command to open the target platform preference page
     
     - Encountered bug:  When the command is clicked, the target platform
       preference page dialog is opened and the cheatsheet is loaded into
       the system tray of it; but, the subitem task is not checked as 
       being completed.  Only when the "OK" button is selected on the dialog
       and the cheatsheet returns to the cheatsheet view is the subitem task
       checked as being completed.
       
See attached Patch #1
